item.title: PyOhio 2011: Evolving an internal web service
item.description:
Description

Evolving an internal web service

Presented by Taavi Burns

Over the past few years, FreshBooks' core business logic has been moving into a Python web-service backend using Pylons and SQLAlchemy. Come hear why we did it, and stories of its architecture, testing methods, deployment, and monitoring.
item.dc:creator: Taavi Burns

item.title: Drive-in Double-header: Datetimes and Log analysis
item.description:
Summary

What you need to know about datetimes: time, datetime, and calendar from the standard library are a bit messy. Find out what to use where and how (particularly when you have users in many timezones), and what extra modules you might want to look into.

Log analysis for web applications: Use iPython, matplotlib, and some custom functions to slice, dice, and visualise your app through its logs.
item.dc:creator: Taavi Burns

item.title: Server Log Analysis with Pandas
item.description:
Summary

Use iPython, matplotlib, and Pandas to slice, dice, and visualise your application's behaviour through its logs.
item.dc:creator: Taavi Burns
